intro: Murdannia dimorphoides subsp. dimorphoides, commonly known as the two-form grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
